segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious the woman is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying that plate like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is literally at her feet, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are right behind her, and she has no idea what they’re doing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or distracted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dish towel is wrapped so tightly around the plate, like she’s in a trance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what she’s thinking about that’s so important.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is just bizarre to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she snaps out of it before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The longer I look, the more I can’t understand her.
segments.speaker: PAR
